intro: Webbia nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed webbia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or violet. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
